Iri Lihat Tetangga, Iwan Bule Ingin PSSI Punya Gedung Sendiri
04 Nov 2019, 22:10 by Antara, Nurdin Saleh
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Ketua Umum PSSI Komjen Pol Mochamad Iriawan alias Iwan Bule mengatakan bahwa PSSI ingin mempunyai gedung kantor sendiri seperti lazimnya federasi-federasi sepak bola di negara lain.
“Kami ingin mempunyai gedung sendiri yang bisa dibanggakan. Negara-negara seperti Vietnam, Thailand, Filipina, dan Malaysia sudah memilikinya,” ujar Iwan di Kantor Kemenpora, Jakarta, Senin.
Menurut pria berusia 57 tahun itu, idealnya PSSI memiliki gedung dengan lapangan latihan, baik sintetis maupun alami serta wisma atlet di dalam kompleksnya.
Hal itu juga sesuai dengan janji kampanye Iwan Bule sebagai ketua umum PSSI yaitu membuat sebuah ‘Indonesia Soccer Camp’ di kawasan Jabodetabek.
Meski terus berupaya merealisasikan itu, dia menyadari rencana itu bisa saja tidak bisa diwujudkan karena terganjal soal lahan yang terbatas. Jika itu terjadi, Iwan menyebut gedung PSSI mungkin saja dibangun di kawasan Gelora Bung Karno.
“Ada lahan sekitar 2.000 meter di GBK. Nanti akan kami lihat. Mudah-mudahan Pak Menpora Zainudin Amali bisa menyampaikan hal ini kepada Presiden Joko Widodo. Semoga dapat diteruskan juga ke Kementerian Agraria dan Tata Ruang dan Badan Perencanaan Pembangunan Nasional,” kata Iwan.
Mendengar harapan itu, Menpora Zainudin Amali menegaskan dukungannya. “Kami mendukung penuh prasarana yang diharapkan PSSI,” kata Zainudin.
PSSI tidak memiliki kantor tetap setelah markasnya di kawasan Stadion Utama Gelora Bung Karno, Jakarta, harus dipindahkan karena stadion tersebut harus direnovasi untuk Asian Games 2018.
Sejak saat itu, PSSI berpindah-pindah kantor mulai dari Gedung Grand Rubina, Kuningan, Jakarta, lalu sebuah rumah di kawasan Kemang, Jakarta Selatan dan saat ini berada di gedung mal fX, Sudirman, Jakarta Pusat.

Iri See Neighbors, Iwan Bule Wants PSSI to Have Its Own Building
Nov 04 2019, 22:10 by Antara, Nurdin Saleh
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - PSSI General Chairperson Komjen Pol Mochamad Iriawan alias Iwan Bule said that PSSI wants to have its own office building as is usual for soccer federations in other countries.
"We want to have our own building to be proud of. Countries like Vietnam, Thailand, the Philippines and Malaysia already have it, "Iwan said at the Kemenpora Office, Jakarta, Monday.
According to the 57-year-old man, ideally PSSI has a building with a training ground, both synthetic and natural as well as athlete's homestead in the complex.
It was also in accordance with Iwan Bule's campaign promise as PSSI's general chairman to create an 'Indonesia Soccer Camp' in the Greater Jakarta area.
Despite continuing to try to realize it, he realized that the plan could not be realized because it was hampered by limited land issues. If that happens, Iwan said the PSSI building might be built in the Bung Karno Gelora area.
"There are about 2,000 meters of land in GBK. We will see it later. Hopefully Mr. Menpora Zainudin Amali can convey this to President Joko Widodo. Hopefully it can also be forwarded to the Ministry of Agrarian Affairs and Spatial Planning and the National Development Planning Agency, "said Iwan.
Hearing this hope, Menpora Zainudin Amali stressed his support. "We fully support the infrastructure that PSSI hopes for," Zainudin said.
PSSI does not have a permanent office after its headquarters in the Gelora Bung Karno Main Stadium area, Jakarta, must be moved because the stadium must be renovated for the 2018 Asian Games.
Since then, PSSI has moved offices starting from the Grand Rubina Building, Kuningan, Jakarta, then a house in the Kemang area, South Jakarta and is currently in the fX mall building, Sudirman, Central Jakarta.
